page.title: 20Devonshire Words.
page.content: Many of the old{dialect words}or {ways of speech}have almost disappeared from the spoken language. These are some still{used by adults and children of Ipplepen. Jasper:{wasp.}Go school:{go to school. Chuggypig:{woodlouse.}Dimpsey:{dusk. Granfergrig:{woodlouse. Maze:{weak minded.}Byloes:{bedtime. Smitch:{smoulder, burn.}Gurt:{great. Maid:{young girl.}Chiple:{spring onion Shippen:{cattleshed.}Lumuck:{fool. Linhay:{outbuilding or farmshed. I baint be:{I am not. The children,teacher and parents of {Class 2, Ipplepen School}have enjoyed finding out about the area in which they live. The 28 children are aged between 8-10.Their teacher is ancient. {We all contributed to the project. Finding out was great fun, so too was typing in, but editing was not!
